creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: nude male figure lying with PL arm over head; PR arm stretched over body, holding onto a spear; angels and cupids in clouds above looking on sadly; wild boar at L; trees on cliff
marks:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamps

in graphit signed and dated in plate, bottom center: [STE. F.
provenance: Friedrich August II de Saxe, Dresden; Kupferstich-Kabinett, Staaliche Kunstsammlungen, Dresden (duplicate), sale around 1885; Hugo Ahne (1875-1964); Dr. K.O. (possibly Dr. Karl Max Osthof); John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Venus, Three Graces, and Cupid Mourning the Death of Adonis
